intro: Astragalus creticus, commonly known as the Cretan milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor environments. Astragalus creticus is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting pollinator populations.
